intro: Callirhoe pedata, commonly known as the showy false sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features upright, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically pink to red, with yellow centers, and bloom from summer to fall. Callirhoe pedata is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
